title: Is Plymouth vs Liverpool on TV and how to stream the FA Cup clash ?
body_text:
Liverpool continue their challenge on four fronts this season as they go to Plymouth Argyle in the FA Cup on Sunday afternoon.
The bottom side in the Championship have a huge task on their hands as they take on the team sitting top of the Premier League.
The Reds have also been thoroughly impressive in the Champions League and have booked their place in the Carabao Cup final where they will face Newcastle.
It is a serious contrast for the Pilgrims who are four points adrift of safety in the Championship, although they did pick up an impressive win last time out, beating West Brom 2-1 last weekend.
Manager Miron Muslic has been brought in to replace Wayne Rooney, taking his first job in English football having been at Belgian side Cercle Brugge previously.
He has already shown that he can spring an FA Cup surprise, with Plymouth beating Brentford 1-0 away from home in the third round, in a pretty substantial shock.
Sunday will be the first time the teams have met since 2017, when Plymouth held Liverpool to an FA Cup draw at Anfield before narrowly losing a replay at home.

When is Plymouth vs Liverpool?
The match kicks off at 3pm on Sunday 9 February at Home Park.
Is Plymouth vs Liverpool on TV?
The game is being shown live on ITV with coverage from 2.15pm and will be streamed on ITVX.

When is the draw for the FA Cup fifth round?
The FA Cup draw for the fifth round will take place during the next episode of the One Show on Monday, February 10.
More Trending
The draw is expected to get underway at about 7.10pm GMT.
The fifth-round draw will be live on BBC One, with viewers in the United Kingdom also able to watch online via BBC iPlayer.
Theo Walcott, a two-time winner of the competition with Arsenal, will conduct the draw.
